alert.note: Alert for Waushara (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 6:23AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with heavy rains will impact portions of Waushara County through 715 AM CDT... At 621 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms moving through Waushara County, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Torrential downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Ponding on area roads and localized flooding are possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Waushara County, including the following locations... Saxeville, Coloma, Mount Morris, Auroraville, Wild Rose, Hancock, Borth, Silver Lake, Spring Lake and Lohrville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
